pitrou commented on pull request #11284:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11284#issuecomment-933404176


   I'm ok with the change but it is completely unrelated to file reading performance (which doesn't go through the Python conversion path).


--

amol- commented on pull request #11284:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11284#issuecomment-933546115


   > I'm ok with the change but it is completely unrelated to file reading performance (which doesn't go through the Python conversion path).
   
   Sorry, left this as a branch because I couldn't see locally how the original PR changes impacted the benchmarks, so I opened a PR to tweak them and see if it had any impact on the conbench. I also tried doing a `git bisect` locally to spot the commit that introduced slowdowns, but couldn't see any real difference in the benchmarks.
   
   We will have to dig further if we want to actually find the culprit of the slowdown, I'm having an hard time proving it's related to the changes in https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11076 that seemed the original culprit of the slower timings. 


--

   Sorry, left this as a draft branch because I couldn't see locally how the original PR changes impacted the benchmarks, so I opened a PR to tweak them and see if it had any impact on the conbench. I also tried doing a `git bisect` locally to spot the commit that introduced slowdowns, but couldn't see any real difference in the benchmarks.
   
   We will have to dig further if we want to actually find the culprit of the slowdown, I'm having an hard time proving it's related to the changes in https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11076 that seemed the original culprit of the slower timings.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11284#issuecomment-933546115


   > I'm ok with the change but it is completely unrelated to file reading performance (which doesn't go through the Python conversion path).
   
   Sorry, left this as a draft branch because I couldn't see locally how the original PR changes impacted the benchmarks, so I opened a PR to tweak them and see if it had any impact on the conbench. I also tried doing a `git bisect` locally to spot the commit that introduced slowdowns, but couldn't see any real difference in the benchmarks.
   
   We will have to dig further if we want to actually find the culprit of the slowdown, I'm having an hard time proving it's related to the changes in https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11076 that seemed the original culprit of the slower timings according to the conbench report.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
After ARROW-6626 was merged, we're seeing a slow down in file reading benchmarks:

One example: https://conbench.ursa.dev/benchmarks/b92e91fe8a4041148360d9433552277b/

comments.body:
ARROW-6626 can't have anything to do with file reading performance.

Possible culprit is ARROW-14026 (https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11189)

This issue was last updated over 90 days ago, which may be an indication it is no longer being actively worked. To better reflect the current state, the issue is being unassigned. Please feel free to re-take assignment of the issue if it is being actively worked, or if you plan to start that work soon.
